data.title: Kelley Johnson - 2023 - Women's Volleyball

Summit League First Team (2022, 2023)
2022 College Sports Communicators (CSC) Academic

14 Kelley Johnson

Position Setter

Height 5-10

Class Senior

Hometown Eagan, Minn.

High School Eagan HS

Biography

Summit League Setter of the Year (2022, 2023)

Summit League First Team (2022, 2023)

2022 College Sports Communicators (CSC) Academic All-America First Team

2023 CSC Academic All-America Second Team

CSC Academic All-District Team (2022, 2023)

Summit League Scholar of the Championship (2022, 2023)

Summit League All-Academic Team (2020-21, 2022, 2023)

Summit League Commissioner's List of Academic Excellence (2021, 2022, 2023)

Summit League Academic Honor Roll (2021, 2022, 2023)

CAREER: Finished her career with the most assists in the NDSU Division I era with 4,019, which ranked sixth all-time in Bison history…Her 4,019 assists were slotted 14th among active players in NCAA Division I in 2023…One of only four players in the NDSU Division I era to eclipse 3,000 career assists…Averaged 8.78 assists per set, which ranked seventh in Bison history…Surpassed 1,000 career digs in the 2023 season with 1,115…One of only three players in the NDSU Division I era to record at least 3,000 career assists and 1,000 career digs, joining Jennifer Lopez (2008-11) and Brianna Rasmusson (2014-17)…Posted 13 matches with at least 50 assists….Closed her career recording double figures in assists in 62 straight matches spanning her final two seasons.

2023 SEASON (SENIOR): Appeared in all 29 matches…Posted a team-best 10.48 assists per set…Her 10.48 assists per set led the Summit League and ranked 29th in the nation…Recorded at least 1,000 assists for the second straight season with a team-best 1,163…Her 1,163 assists ranked second in the Summit League and 46th in the nation…Helped guide the Bison offense that led the Summit League and ranked 38th in nation with 12.54 assists per set…Recorded double figures in assists in all 29 matches, including six matches with at least 50 assists…Slotted third on the team in digs with 271…Averaged 2.44 digs per set…Surpassed the 1,000 career digs mark with 1,115…Added 88 kills and 22 service aces…Posted 10 double-doubles…Averaged a league-best 10.63 assists per set in Summit League play and passed out 638 total assists…Became the first player in Bison history to win the Summit League Setter of the Year award in back-to-back seasons…Named to the All-Summit League First Team for the second straight season…Earned College Sports Communicators (CSC) Academic All-America Second Team honors ….Became the first two-time Summit League volleyball student-athlete to earn CSC Academic All-America honors for a second straight season…Was one of only eight players in the country to garner CSC Academic All-America honors for a second straight season.

2022 SEASON (SENIOR): Appeared in all 33 matches…Led the Summit League and ranked eighth in the nation with 1,342 assists…Averaged 10.57 assists per set…Recorded double figures in assists in all 33 matches, including six matches with 50 or more…Helped guide the NDSU offense that was positioned 10th in the nation and led the Summit League with 1,615 assists…Assisted the Bison offense that was slotted seventh in the nation and led the Summit League with 1,759 kills…Ranked second on the team with 352 digs and averaged 2.77 per set…Reached double figures in digs in 22 of 33 matches…Recorded a team-best 23 double-doubles...Recorded a season-high 58 assists against Chicago State and Central Michigan on Sept. 9...Posted a season-best 25 digs against Chicago State on Sept. 9.

2021 SEASON (JUNIOR): Played in 15 matches and appeared in 45 sets…Totaled 302 total assists…Averaged 6.71 assists per set… Reached double digits in assists 10 times…Recorded two double-doubles…Notched a season-high 44 assists and season-best 13 digs in the win at Western Illinois on Sept. 30.

2020-21 SEASON (SOPHOMORE): Played in all 18 matches and all 66 sets on the season … Led NDSU with 682 total assists and 10.33 assists per set … Also led the Bison with 20 service aces and ranked fourth on the team with 2.47 digs per set … Season-high 4 aces against Omaha on Mar. 13 … Season-high 56 assists in a five-set victory over Oral Roberts on Feb. 14 … 47 assists in the season-opening win over North Dakota on Jan. 22 … Voted to the Summit League Academic All-League Team.

2019 SEASON (FRESHMAN): Played in 29 matches and 108 sets ... Finished with 535 assists and 254 digs, averaging 4.95 assists and 2.35 digs per set ... Added 13 service aces and six kills ... Had nine matches with double-figure digs including a career-high 22 in the 3-2 comeback win at Oral Roberts on Oct. 20 ... That match also produced the career-best 33 assists that led to one of her nine double-doubles.

HIGH SCHOOL: Led Eagan High School coached by Kathy Gillen to a pair of runner-up finishes at the Minnesota state volleyball tournament over the past two seasons … The Wildcats had a 25-3 record in 2018 … Had 42 service aces, 320 digs and 870 assists over the past two seasons … Played alongside current NDSU outside hitter Ally Murphy … Member of National Honor Society, High Schoolers Against Cancer, and Students Against Destructive Decisions … Active with church youth group … Played for Northern Lights coached by Damien Fox and Eric Poppelman … Three-time AAU Academic All-American.

PERSONAL: Daughter of Bruce and Maureen Johnson … Has one brother, Ryan, and one sister, Nicole … Brother, Ryan, played basketball at the University of St. Thomas, and sister, Nicole, played volleyball for the University of Illinois at Chicago … College major is biochemistry.
